question_text: Based on the provided paper content, compare the TPO yield performance between fluidized bed and fixed bed reactors, explaining the underlying reasons for the observed differences in product distribution.
standard_answer: The comparison of reactor types reveals significant differences in TPO yield performance. Fluidized bed reactors achieve maximum TPO yield, while fixed bed and mechanically mixed reactors provide approximately 10% lower TPO production efficiency. This difference stems from fundamental process characteristics: 'Fast pyrolysis yields more liquid fraction, due to avoided secondary reactions, whereas the main product of slow pyrolysis is a solid fraction.' Fluidized bed reactors typically operate as fast pyrolysis systems with rapid heating rates and short vapor residence times, minimizing secondary cracking reactions that would otherwise convert liquid products into gases or promote solid formation. In contrast, fixed bed reactors often represent slow pyrolysis conditions with longer residence times, allowing more extensive secondary reactions that reduce liquid yield in favor of solid char production. The enhanced mixing and heat transfer in fluidized beds enable more efficient and uniform thermal decomposition of tyre materials at optimal temperatures, maximizing primary pyrolysis reactions that produce liquid TPO while suppressing undesirable secondary reactions that lead to increased solid fraction formation.
